name: perfect crochet t-shirt
notes:
this simple, classic top is designed to be your perfect go-to t-shirt! the shaped neckline, slightly relaxed fit, and excellent drape all come together in perfect harmony to create a crochet version of a classic tee.

this raglan style t-shirt is worked from the top, down. after the first few rounds are worked flat to
shape the front neckline, this t-shirt will be worked in the round.


[a free version of this pattern can be viewed on my blog.][2]  

this t-shirt is designed in 9 sizes:  
xs, (s, m, l, xl), (2x, 3x, 4x, 5x)
finished bust/chest circumference: 32, (36, 40, 44, 48), (52, 56, 60, 64)”
finished length: 22.5, (23, 23, 23.5, 23.5), (24, 24, 24.5, 24.5)”

this top is designed to be worn with 0-4” of positive ease at the bust. model is 6' tall, has a 33” bust, and is wearing a size small with 3” of positive ease. for best fit, choose a size that is 0-4” larger than your corresponding bust measurement.

materials:
3, (4, 4, 5, 5), (6, 6, 7, 8) skeins / 696, (928, 928, 1160, 1160), (1392, 1392, 1624, 1624) yards lion brand coboo yarn (shown in white)
size us f-5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook
removable stitch marker
tapestry needle to weave in ends

gauge: 19 sts and 17 rows = 4” in linen stitch


this pattern is written in us english terms.
